intro: Triteleia graminifolia, commonly known as the grassleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, round seed pods that split open to release seeds. Triteleia graminifolia is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in coastal and inland areas of California.
